citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Bifunctional enzyme which can phosphorylate or dephosphorylate isocitrate dehydrogenase (IDH) on a specific serine residue. This is a regulatory mechanism which enables bacteria to bypass the Krebs cycle via the glyoxylate shunt in response to the source of carbon. When bacteria are grown on glucose, IDH is fully active and unphosphorylated, but when grown on acetate or ethanol, the activity of IDH declines drastically concomitant with its phosphorylation

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Carrier of the growing fatty acid chain in fatty acid biosynthesis

4'-phosphopantetheine is transferred from CoA to a specific serine of apo-ACP by acpS. This modification is essential for activity because fatty acids are bound in thioester linkage to the sulfhydryl of the prosthetic group

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + acetate + CoA = AMP + diphosphate + acetyl-CoA
Acetylated. Deacetylation by the SIR2-homolog deacetylase activates the enzyme
Belongs to the ATP-dependent AMP-binding enzyme family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + acetate + CoA = AMP + diphosphate + acetyl-CoA
Acetylated. Deacetylation by the SIR2-homolog deacetylase activates the enzyme
Belongs to the ATP-dependent AMP-binding enzyme family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the adenosine and AMP deaminases family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Mediates the hydrolysis of agmatine into N-carbamoylputrescine in the arginine decarboxylase (ADC) pathway of putrescine biosynthesis, a basic polyamine
Polyamine biosynthesis; polyamine biosynthesis via ADC pathway; putrescine from agmatine: step 2
Belongs to the agmatine deiminase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Serves to protect the cell against DNA damage by alkyl hydroperoxides. It can use either NADH or NADPH as electron donor for direct reduction of redox dyes or of alkyl hydroperoxides when combined with the ahpC protein
The active site is a redox-active disulfide bond
Belongs to the class-II pyridine nucleotide-disulfide oxidoreductase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Possibly a processive enzyme that polymerizes GDP-mannuronic acid

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Produces a precursor for alginate polymerization. The alginate layer provides a protective barrier against host immune defenses and antibiotics
Belongs to the mannose-6-phosphate isomerase type 2 family

protein.name: Alginate biosynthesis transcriptional regulatory protein algB

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Positive regulator of the alginate biosynthetic gene algD

feature.description: Alginate biosynthesis transcriptional regulatory protein algB

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: The phosphomannomutase activity produces a precursor for alginate polymerization. The alginate layer causes a mucoid phenotype and provides a protective barrier against host immune defenses and antibiotics. Also involved in core-LPS biosynthesis due to its phosphoglucomutase activity. Essential for biofilm production
Belongs to the phosphohexose mutase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the oxidation of guanosine diphospho-D-mannose (GDP-D-mannose) to GDP-D-mannuronic acid, a precursor for alginate polymerization. The alginate layer causes a mucoid phenotype and provides a protective barrier against host immune defenses and antibiotics
Belongs to the UDP-glucose/GDP-mannose dehydrogenase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Has non-porin-like, channel-forming properties and probably functions as an alginate permeability pore

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Together with algI and algJ, forms an inner membrane complex which probably interacts with the alginate polymerization-transport complex and adds acetyl groups at the O-2 and O-3 positions of polymannuronic acid. Acetylation of alginate is important for the architecture of biofilms and increases the ability of alginate to act as a defense barrier

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Bifunctional protein that converts poly(beta-D-mannuronate) to alpha-L-guluronate and that is also part of a periplasmic protein complex that serves as a scaffold that leads the newly formed alginate polymer through the periplasmic space to the outer membrane secretin algE
Belongs to the D-mannuronate C5-epimerase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Together with algJ and algF, forms an inner membrane complex which probably interacts with the alginate polymerization-transport complex and adds acetyl groups at the O-2 and O-3 positions of polymannuronic acid. Acetylation of alginate is important for the architecture of biofilms and increases the ability of alginate to act as a defense barrier
Belongs to the membrane-bound acyltransferase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Together with algI and algF, forms an inner membrane complex which probably interacts with the alginate polymerization-transport complex and adds acetyl groups at the O-2 and O-3 positions of polymannuronic acid. Acetylation of alginate is important for the architecture of biofilms and increases the ability of alginate to act as a defense barrier

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: May be involved in the polymerization of mannuronate to alginate
Attached to the membrane by a lipid anchor

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Depolymerizes alginate by cleaving the beta-1,4 glycosidic bond
Eliminative cleavage of polysaccharides containing beta-D-mannuronate residues to give oligosaccharides with 4-deoxy-alpha-L-erythro-hex-4-enopyranuronosyl groups at their ends
Belongs to the polysaccharide lyase 5 family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Degradation of allantoin (purine catabolism); third step
Belongs to the ureidoglycolate hydrolase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Presumably involved in the processing and regular turnover of intracellular proteins. Catalyzes the removal of unsubstituted N-terminal amino acids from various peptides

Release of an N-terminal amino acid, Xaa-|-Yaa-, in which Xaa is preferably Leu, but may be other amino acids including Pro although not Arg or Lys, and Yaa may be Pro. Amino acid amides and methyl esters are also readily hydrolyzed, but rates on arylamides are exceedingly low
Belongs to the peptidase M17 family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the Ap4A hydrolase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the peptidase M18 family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes a salvage reaction resulting in the formation of AMP, that is energically less costly than de novo synthesis
Belongs to the purine/pyrimidine phosphoribosyltransferase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Channel that permits osmotically driven movement of water in both directions. It is involved in the osmoregulation and in the maintenance of cell turgor during volume expansion in rapidly growing cells. It mediates rapid entry or exit of water in response to abrupt changes in osmolarity
Aquaporins contain two tandem repeats each containing three membrane-spanning domains and a pore-forming loop with the signature motif Asn-Pro-Ala (NPA)

feature.description: Involved in tetramerization or stability of the tetramer

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Arginine degradation via arginine deiminase; first step
Belongs to the arginine deiminase family

Belongs to the NAGSA dehydrogenase family. Type 1 subfamily

comment.text: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-arginine biosynthesis; N(2)-acetyl-L-ornithine from L-glutamate: step 4
May also have succinyldiaminopimelate aminotransferase activity, thus carrying out the corresponding step in lysine biosynthesis
Belongs to the class-III pyridoxal-phosphate-dependent aminotransferase family

citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-arginine biosynthesis; L-ornithine and N-acetyl-L-glutamate from L-glutamate and N(2)-acetyl-L-ornithine (cyclic): single step
Heterotetramer of two alpha and two beta chains
Some bacteria possess a monofunctional argJ, i.e., capable of catalyzing only the fifth step of the arginine biosynthetic pathway

comment.text: Transforms N(2)-succinylglutamate into succinate and glutamate
Arginine catabolism; arginine succinyltransferase pathway; fifth (last) step
Belongs to the aspA/astE family. Succinylglutamate desuccinylase subfamily

citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: May conjugate Arg from its aminoacyl-tRNA to the N-termini of proteins containing an N-terminal aspartate or glutamate

protein.name: Potassium-transporting ATPase A chain
Potassium-translocating ATPase A chain
ATP phosphohydrolase [potassium-transporting] A chain
Potassium binding and translocating subunit A

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: One of the components of the high-affinity ATP-driven potassium transport (or KDP) system, which catalyzes the hydrolysis of ATP coupled with the exchange of hydrogen and potassium ions
ATP + H(2)O + K(+)(Out) = ADP + phosphate + K(+)(In)

protein.name: Potassium-transporting ATPase C chain
Potassium-translocating ATPase C chain
ATP phosphohydrolase [potassium-transporting] C chain
Potassium binding and translocating subunit C

citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: One of the components of the high-affinity ATP-driven potassium transport (or KDP) system, which catalyzes the hydrolysis of ATP coupled with the exchange of hydrogen and potassium ions. The C subunit may be involved in assembly of the KDP complex
ATP + H(2)O + K(+)(Out) = ADP + phosphate + K(+)(In)

protein.name: ATP synthase epsilon chain
ATP synthase F1 sector epsilon subunit

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Produces ATP from ADP in the presence of a proton gradient across the membrane
ATP + H(2)O + H(+)(In) = ADP + phosphate + H(+)(Out)

F-type ATPases have 2 components, CF(1) - the catalytic core - and CF(0) - the membrane proton channel. CF(1) has five subunits: alpha(3), beta(3), gamma(1), delta(1), epsilon(1). CF(0) has three main subunits: a, b and c
Belongs to the ATPase epsilon chain family

protein.name: ATP synthase gamma chain
ATP synthase F1 sector gamma subunit

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Produces ATP from ADP in the presence of a proton gradient across the membrane. The gamma chain is believed to be important in regulating ATPase activity and the flow of protons through the CF(0) complex
ATP + H(2)O + H(+)(In) = ADP + phosphate + H(+)(Out)

F-type ATPases have 2 components, CF(1) - the catalytic core - and CF(0) - the membrane proton channel. CF(1) has five subunits: alpha(3), beta(3), gamma(1), delta(1), epsilon(1). CF(0) has three main subunits: a, b and c
Belongs to the ATPase gamma chain family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: A possible function for this protein is to guide the assembly of the membrane sector of the ATPase enzyme complex
Belongs to the bacterial atpI family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Can catalyze the oxidation of choline to betaine aldehyde and betaine aldehyde to glycine betaine
Choline + acceptor = betaine aldehyde + reduced acceptor
Betaine biosynthesis from choline; first step
Belongs to the GMC oxidoreductase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Betaine aldehyde + NAD(+) + H(2)O = betaine + NADH
Betaine biosynthesis from choline; second (last) step
Belongs to the aldehyde dehydrogenase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the carboxylate-amine ligase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Forms oxaloacetate, a four-carbon dicarboxylic acid source for the tricarboxylic acid cycle

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: 2 ATP + L-glutamine + CO(2) + H(2)O = 2 ADP + phosphate + L-glutamate + carbamoyl phosphate
Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-arginine biosynthesis; carbamoyl phosphate from HCO(3)(-): single step
Nucleotide biosynthesis; UMP biosynthesis; UMP from HCO(3)(-): step 1
Nucleotide biosynthesis; UMP biosynthesis; UMP from HCO(3)(-): step 1
Composed of two chains; the small (or glutamine) chain promotes the hydrolysis of glutamine to ammonia, which is used by the large (or ammonia) chain to synthesize carbamoyl phosphate

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: 2 ATP + L-glutamine + CO(2) + H(2)O = 2 ADP + phosphate + L-glutamate + carbamoyl phosphate
Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-arginine biosynthesis; carbamoyl phosphate from HCO(3)(-): single step
Nucleotide biosynthesis; UMP biosynthesis; UMP from HCO(3)(-): step 1
Nucleotide biosynthesis; UMP biosynthesis; UMP from HCO(3)(-): step 1
Composed of two chains; the small (or glutamine) chain promotes the hydrolysis of glutamine to ammonia, which is used by the large (or ammonia) chain to synthesize carbamoyl phosphate

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: May catalyze the methylation of C-1 in cobalt-precorrin-5 and the subsequent extrusion of acetic acid from the resulting intermediate to form cobalt-precorrin-6A
Adenosylcobalamin biosynthesis; anaerobic branch of corrin ring synthesis; seventh step

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: DNA-binding protein that preferentially recognizes a curved DNA sequence. It is probably a functional analog of dnaJ; displays overlapping activities with dnaJ, but functions under different conditions, probably acting as a molecular chaperone in an adaptive response to environmental stresses other than heat shock. Lacks autonomous chaperone activity; binds native substrates and targets them for recognition by dnaK. Its activity is inhibited by the binding of cbpM

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Interacts with cbpA and inhibits both the dnaJ-like co-chaperone activity and the DNA binding activity of cbpA. Together with cbpA, modulates the activity of the dnaK chaperone system. Does not inhibit the co-chaperone activity of dnaJ

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the addition and repair of the essential 3'-terminal CCA sequence in tRNAs without using a nucleic acid template. Adds these three nucleotides in the order of C, C, and A to the tRNA nucleotide-73, using CTP and ATP as substrates and producing inorganic pyrophosphate. Also shows phosphatase, 2'-nucleotidase and 2',3'-cyclic phosphodiesterase activities. These phosphohydrolase activities are probably involved in the repair of the tRNA 3'-CCA terminus degraded by intracellular RNases
Mg(2+) ion for nucleotidyltransferase activity. Ni(2+) ion for phosphatase activity
Monomer. Can also form homodimers and oligomers
Comprises two domains: an N-terminal domain containing the nucleotidyltransferase activity and a C-terminal HD domain associated with both phosphodiesterase and phosphatase activities
A single active site specifically recognizes both ATP and CTP and is responsible for their addition
Belongs to the tRNA nucleotidyltransferase/poly(A) polymerase family. Bacterial CCA-adding enzyme type 1 subfamily

feature.description: ATP or CTP; phosphate group; via amide nitrogen

protein.name: Cytochrome c biogenesis ATP-binding export protein ccmA
Heme exporter protein A

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Part of the ABC transporter complex ccmAB involved in the biogenesis of c-type cytochromes; once thought to export heme, this seems not to be the case, but its exact role is uncertain. Responsible for energy coupling to the transport system
ATP + H(2)O + heme(In) = ADP + phosphate + heme(Out)
The complex is composed of two ATP-binding proteins (ccmA) and two transmembrane proteins (ccmB)
Belongs to the ABC transporter family. CcmA exporter (TC 3.A.1.107) subfamily

feature.description: Cytochrome c biogenesis ATP-binding export protein ccmA

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Binds to Cpn60 in the presence of Mg-ATP and suppresses the ATPase activity of the latter
Heptamer of 7 subunits arranged in a ring
Belongs to the groES chaperonin family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Prevents misfolding and promotes the refolding and proper assembly of unfolded polypeptides generated under stress conditions
Oligomer of 14 subunits composed of two stacked rings of 7 subunits

protein.name: Chemotaxis response regulator protein-glutamate methylesterase of group 1 operon

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Involved in the modulation of the chemotaxis system; catalyzes the demethylation of specific methylglutamate residues introduced into the chemoreceptors (methyl-accepting chemotaxis proteins) by cheR
Protein L-glutamate O(5)-methyl ester + H(2)O = protein L-glutamate + methanol
The N-terminal regulatory domain inhibits the activity of the C-terminal effector domain
Phosphorylated by cheA. Phosphorylation suppresses the inhibitory activity of the N-terminal domain
P.putida strain KT2440 does not have a chemotaxis group 2 operon

feature.description: Chemotaxis response regulator protein-glutamate methylesterase of group 1 operon

protein.name: Chemotaxis response regulator protein-glutamate methylesterase of group 3 operon

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Involved in the modulation of the chemotaxis system; catalyzes the demethylation of specific methylglutamate residues introduced into the chemoreceptors (methyl-accepting chemotaxis proteins) by cheR
Protein L-glutamate O(5)-methyl ester + H(2)O = protein L-glutamate + methanol
The N-terminal regulatory domain inhibits the activity of the C-terminal effector domain
Phosphorylated by cheA. Phosphorylation suppresses the inhibitory activity of the N-terminal domain
P.putida strain KT2440 does not have a chemotaxis group 2 operon

feature.description: Chemotaxis response regulator protein-glutamate methylesterase of group 3 operon

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Part of a stress-induced multi-chaperone system, it is involved in the recovery of the cell from heat-induced damage, in cooperation with dnaK, dnaJ and grpE. Acts before dnaK, in the processing of protein aggregates. Protein binding stimulates the ATPase activity; ATP hydrolysis unfolds the denatured protein aggregates, which probably helps expose new hydrophobic binding sites on the surface of clpB-bound aggregates, contributing to the solubilization and refolding of denatured protein aggregates by dnaK

The N-terminal domain probably functions as a substrate-discriminating domain, recruiting aggregated proteins to the clpB hexamer and/or stabilizing bound proteins. The NBD2 domain is responsible for oligomerization, whereas the NBD1 domain stabilizes the hexamer probably in an ATP-dependent manner. The movement of the coiled-coil domain is essential for clpB ability to rescue proteins from an aggregated state, probably by pulling apart large aggregated proteins, which are bound between the coiled-coils motifs of adjacent clpB subunits in the functional hexamer

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Cleaves peptides in various proteins in a process that requires ATP hydrolysis. Has a chymotrypsin-like activity. Plays a major role in the degradation of misfolded proteins

Hydrolysis of proteins to small peptides in the presence of ATP and magnesium. Alpha-casein is the usual test substrate. In the absence of ATP, only oligopeptides shorter than five residues are hydrolyzed (such as succinyl-Leu-Tyr-|-NHMec; and Leu-Tyr-Leu-|-Tyr-Trp, in which cleavage of the -Tyr-|-Leu-and -Tyr-|-Trp bonds also occurs)
Belongs to the peptidase S14 family

protein.name: ATP-dependent Clp protease adaptor protein clpS

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Involved in the modulation of the specificity of the clpAP-mediated ATP-dependent protein degradation
Binds to the N-terminal domain of the chaperone ClpA

feature.description: ATP-dependent Clp protease adaptor protein clpS

protein.name: ATP-dependent Clp protease ATP-binding subunit clpX

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP-dependent specificity component of the Clp protease. It directs the protease to specific substrates. Can perform chaperone functions in the absence of clpP
Belongs to the clpX chaperone family

feature.description: ATP-dependent Clp protease ATP-binding subunit clpX

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the reversible phosphatidyl group transfer from one phosphatidylglycerol molecule to another to form cardiolipin (CL) (diphosphatidylglycerol) and glycerol
Belongs to the phospholipase D family. Cardiolipin synthase subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Reversibly transfers an adenylyl group from ATP to 4'-phosphopantetheine, yielding dephospho-CoA (dPCoA) and pyrophosphate
Belongs to the bacterial coaD family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the phosphorylation of the 3'-hydroxyl group of dephosphocoenzyme A to form coenzyme A

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes amidations at positions B, D, E, and G on adenosylcobyrinic A,C-diamide. NH(2) groups are provided by glutamine, and one molecule of ATP is hydrogenolyzed for each amidation
Belongs to the cobB/cobQ family. CobQ subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Joins Ado-cobinamide-GDP and alpha-ribazole to generate adenosylcobalamin (Ado-cobalamin)

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the synthesis of alpha-ribazole-5'-phosphate from nicotinate mononucleotide (NAMN) and 5,6-dimethylbenzimidazole (DMB)

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the removal of elemental sulfur and selenium atoms from L-cysteine, L-cystine, L-selenocysteine, and L-selenocystine to produce L-alanine
Belongs to the class-V pyridoxal-phosphate-dependent aminotransferase family. Csd subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: May be involved in the control of utilization of gamma-aminobutyric acid

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Could accelerate the degradation of some genes transcripts potentially through selective RNA binding

protein.name: Cell volume regulation protein A homolog

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Participates in control of cell volume in low-osmolarity conditions
Belongs to the Na(+)/H(+) exchanger (TC 2.A.36.5.1) family. CvrA subfamily

feature.description: Cell volume regulation protein A homolog

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Part of the ABC transporter complex cysAWTP involved in sulfate/thiosulfate import. Responsible for energy coupling to the transport system
ATP + H(2)O + sulfate(Out) = ADP + phosphate + sulfate(In)
The complex is composed of two ATP-binding proteins (cysA), two transmembrane proteins (cysT and cysW) and a solute-binding protein (cysP)
Belongs to the ABC transporter family. Sulfate/tungstate importer (TC 3.A.1.6) subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: First step in the sulfate activation pathway. This reaction occurs early in the reductive branch of the cysteine biosynthetic pathway
Heterodimer composed of cysD, the smaller subunit, and cysN
Belongs to the PAPS reductase family. CysD subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: A D-amino acid + H(2)O + acceptor = a 2-oxo acid + NH(3) + reduced acceptor
Heterodimer of a small and a large subunit
Belongs to the dadA oxidoreductase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: A D-amino acid + H(2)O + acceptor = a 2-oxo acid + NH(3) + reduced acceptor
Heterodimer of a small and a large subunit
Belongs to the dadA oxidoreductase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-lysine biosynthesis via DAP pathway; tetrahydrodipicolinate from L-aspartate: step 4
Belongs to the dihydrodipicolinate reductase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-lysine biosynthesis via DAP pathway; DL-diaminopimelate from LL-diaminopimelate: single step
Belongs to the diaminopimelate epimerase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the dCTP deaminase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Responsible for the transport of dicarboxylates such as succinate, fumarate, and malate from the periplasm across the membrane
Belongs to the sodium:dicarboxylate (SDF) symporter (TC 2.A.23) family
